distance: distance calculation algorithms

 Calculate distance between two points.

Detailed Description

The distance algorithm returns the distance between two geometries. The distance is always returned as a double type, regardless of the input type, because the distance between integer coordinates is a square root and might be a double.
Note:
All primary distance functions return a std::pair<double, bool> with (distance, squared) if squared=true, it is the squared distance, otherwise it is the distance. This is for efficiency, often distance is used for comparisons only and then squared is OK. However, some algorithms such as great circle do NOT use sqrt in their formula and then it is not necessary to first calculate the sqr and lateron take the sqrt

Calculate distance between a point and a linestring (iterator pair).

This version of distance calculates the distance between a point and a line-string, using the default strategy

Parameters:
p point
begin start of the linestring
end end of the linestring
Returns:
the distance
Note:
The point might be of another type the points in the iterator pair (if there is a strategy_traits specialization for this type combination)
Examples:
5_distance_example.cpp.

Calculate distance between a point and a linestring (iterator pair).

This version of distance calculates the distance between a point and a line-string, using the specified strategy

Parameters:
p point
begin start of the linestring
end end of the linestring
strategy strategy to calculate distance of point to segment
Returns:
the distance
Note:
The point might be of another type the points in the iterator pair (if the specified strategy allows this)

The strategy might implement an enclosed point-point distance strategy

template<typename P1 , typename P2 >
double geometry::distance ( const P1 &  p1,
const P2 &  p2 
)

Calculate distance between two points.

This version of distance calculates the distance between two points, using the default distance-calculation-strategy

Parameters:
p1 first point
p2 second point
Returns:
the distance
Note:
The two point may be of different types, if there is a strategy_traits specialization for this type combination
Example:
Example showing distance calculation of two points, in xy and in latlong coordinates 
{
        geometry::point_xy<double> p1(1, 1);
        geometry::point_xy<double> p2(2, 3);
        std::cout << "Distance p1-p2 is "
                << geometry::distance(p1, p2)
                << " units" << std::endl;

        // Read 2 Dutch cities from WKT texts (in decimal degrees)
        geometry::point_ll<geometry::degree, double> a, r;
        geometry::from_wkt("POINT(4.89222 52.3731)", a);
        geometry::from_wkt("POINT(4.47917 51.9308)", r);

        std::cout << "Distance Amsterdam-Rotterdam is "
                << geometry::distance(a, r) / 1000.0
                << " kilometers " << std::endl;
}

template<typename P1 , typename P2 , typename S >
double geometry::distance ( const P1 &  p1,
const P2 &  p2,
const S &  strategy 
)

Calculate distance between two points.

This version of distance calculates the distance between two points, using the specified strategy

Parameters:
p1 first point
p2 second point
strategy strategy to calculate distance between two points
Returns:
the distance
Example:
Example showing distance calculation of two lat long points, using the accurate Vincenty approximation 
{
        typedef geometry::point_ll<geometry::degree, double> LL;
        LL a, r;
        geometry::from_wkt("POINT(4.89222 52.3731)", a);
        geometry::from_wkt("POINT(4.47917 51.9308)", r);

        std::cout << "Distance Amsterdam-Rotterdam is "
                << geometry::distance(a, r,
                                geometry::strategy::distance::vincenty<LL>() )
                                 / 1000.0
                << " kilometers " << std::endl;
}
Examples:
1_point_example.cpp, 2_point_ll_example.cpp, 3_linestring_example.cpp, and 7_custom_point_example.cpp.
